article:
In molecular genetics, an 'open reading frame' (ORF) is the part of a reading
frame that contains no stop codons. The transcription termination pause site is
located after the ORF, beyond the translation stop codon, because if
transcription were to cease before the stop codon, an incomplete protein would
be made during translation.

Normally, inserts which interrupt the reading frame of a subsequent region after
the start codon cause frameshift mutation of the sequence and dislocate the
sequences for stop codons.
